Eliezer Yudkowsky seems to use it as a synonym for “civilizational inadequacy”, on which he has written a book: Inadequate Equilibria by Eliezer Yudkowsky (https://equilibriabook.com/).
From Chapter 4, “Living in an Inadequate World”:
>I once encountered a case of (honest) misunderstanding from someone who thought that when I cited something as an example of civilizational inadequacy (or as I put it at the time, “People are crazy and the world is mad”)
